page.title: 10Fir Tree Farm, Norton
page.content: Probably the oldest building in Norton is Fir Tree Farm, which is up to 700 years old. It is owned by Mr Harvey. The farm house is made out of stone it used to have a thatched roof but about 100 years ago it was tiled and a brick extension built on.The stone part is held up by metal girders to protect it from mining subsidence. Mr Harvey has 250 cattle which are mainly shorthorns. He milks some of the cows for his own use,but mainly he rears the cattle for meat, grazing them in the fields.In the winter he buys hay from local farmers for the cows to eat.He has 68 acres of land and most of it is rough grazing.At the weekends he sells produce from a mobile shop. The farm used to own some fields where the Cornhill housing estate has been built. They used to grow crops there.
